name: outlook-add-in-tag-external-recipients
title: Use Outlook event-based activation to tag external recipients
shortDescription: This sample uses event-based activation to run an Outlook add-in when the user changes recipients while composing a message.
longDescription: This sample uses event-based activation to run an Outlook add-in when the user changes recipients while composing a message. The add-in also uses the appendOnSendAsync API. If external recipients are added, the add-in prepends "[External]" to the message subject and appends a disclaimer to the message body on send.

thumbnails.alt: Screen shot of sample displaying an information bar prompting the user to set up signatures, and sample signature inserted into the email.

references.name: Configure your Outlook add-in for event-based activation
references.description: Without the event-based activation feature, a user has to explicitly launch an add-in to complete their tasks. This feature enables your add-in to run tasks based on certain events, particularly for operations that apply to every item. You can also integrate with the task pane and UI-less functionality.
